A CFT is suspected when there are clustered cases of gastrointestinal or neurological disorders. The diagnosis is made if the clustered cases are compatible with the definition of CFTI, in an environment that is often collective, and where hygiene measures are not respected.

CFTI is a notifiable disease.

Reports are made to the ARS via a specific form, without waiting for the investigation or documentation.

question.title: What is the definition of a CFTI (Clustered Foodborne Toxin Ingestion)?
question.description: A CFT is suspected when there are clustered cases of gastrointestinal or neurological disorders. The diagnosis is made if the clustered cases are compatible with the definition of CFTI, in an environment that is often collective, and where hygiene measures are not respected.

option_a.title: A disease caused by a single traumatic event
option_a.description: A single incident that leads to a specific illness

option_b.title: A disease that occurs in a collective environment with poor hygiene
option_b.description: A disease that spreads quickly in a group with inadequate sanitation

option_c.title: A disease that is not reportable to the ARS
option_c.description: A disease that must be reported to the health authorities

option_d.title: A disease that can be diagnosed without investigation
option_d.description: A disease that can be confirmed without further testing
